perturbation.original_text: Reference is hereby made to that certain fully executed Wireless Content License Agreement Number 12965 dated as of December 16, 2004 ("Agreement"), between TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX LICENSING & MERCHANDISING, division of Fox Entertainment Group, Inc. ("Fox"), as Administrator for Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation ("Trademark Licensor") and Glu Mobile, Inc. f/k/a Sorrent, Inc. ("Licensee").
perturbation.changed_text: Reference is hereby made to that certain fully executed Wireless Content License Agreement Number 12965 dated as of December 16, 2004 ("Agreement"), between TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX LICENSING & MERCHANDISING, division of Fox Entertainment Group, Inc. ("Fox"), as Administrator for Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation ("Trademark Licensor") and Glu Mobile, Inc. f/k/a Sorrent, Inc. ("Recipient").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensee' to 'Recipient' introduces confusion. While 'Licensee' is a standard term for a party receiving a license, 'Recipient' is more general. This raises uncertainty about whether Glu Mobile, Inc. is truly being granted a license, as the specific obligations of a licensee are tied to the term 'Licensee'.

perturbation.original_text:
(a) FOX ASSIGNMENT OF AGREEMENT: Pursuant to Twentieth Century Fox Licensing and Merchandising's assignment of rights and obligations through an assignment dated as of October 1, 2005 by and between Twentieth Century Fox Licensing and Merchandising and Fox Mobile Entertainment Inc., Fox Mobile Entertainment, Inc. is hereby substituted for Twentieth Century Fox Licensing and Merchandising as "Fox" under the Agreement.

(b) LICENSEE CHANGE OF NAME: The parties hereby acknowledge that Licensee's change of name from Sorrent, Inc. to Glu Mobile, Inc.
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) FOX ASSIGNMENT OF AGREEMENT: Pursuant to Twentieth Century Fox Licensing and Merchandising's assignment of rights and obligations through an assignment dated as of October 1, 2005 by and between Twentieth Century Fox Licensing and Merchandising and Fox Mobile Entertainment Inc., Fox Mobile Entertainment, Inc. is hereby substituted for Twentieth Century Fox Licensing and Merchandising as "Fox" under the Agreement.

(b) RECIPIENT CHANGE OF NAME: The parties hereby acknowledge that Licensee's change of name from Sorrent, Inc. to Glu Mobile, Inc.
perturbation.explanation: In section (a) 'Fox' is correctly defined. Then section (b) keeps using 'Licensee', creating a contradiction. This raises uncertainty about whether the entity is bound by the agreement's licensing terms.

perturbation.original_text: Should Fox or its assigns choose to distribute the Wireless Products through Fox's and its assigns' direct-to-consumer distribution channels, Fox or its assigns shall deduct a percentage of Fox's Gross Receipts (defined as monies received by or credited to Fox or its assigns from Fox's or its assigns' direct-to-consumer distribution channels, for the download of the Wireless Products by end users, or the sale or download of Wireless Products to end users) collected from the sale of such Wireless Products ("Distribution Fee") in the amount of ***** percent (*****%) of Fox's Gross Receipts. After Fox or its assigns deducts its Distribution Fee, it shall remit the remainder to Licensee and Licensee shall pay to Fox or its assigns or such other party as Fox or its assigns may designate in writing, Royalties in the amounts set forth in the Agreement or this Amendment.
perturbation.changed_text: Should Fox or its assigns choose to distribute the Wireless Products through Fox's and its assigns' direct-to-consumer distribution channels, Fox or its assigns shall deduct a percentage of Fox's Gross Receipts (defined as monies received by or credited to Fox or its assigns from Fox's or its assigns' direct-to-consumer distribution channels, for the download of the Wireless Products by end users, or the sale or download of Wireless Products to end users) collected from the sale of such Wireless Products ("Distribution Fee") in the amount of ***** percent (*****%) of Fox's Gross Receipts. After Fox or its assigns deducts its Distribution Fee, it shall remit the remainder to Recipient and Licensee shall pay to Fox or its assigns or such other party as Fox or its assigns may designate in writing, Royalties in the amounts set forth in the Agreement or this Amendment.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Recipient' is suddenly used instead of 'Licensee' in one instance, despite 'Licensee' being used in the same sentence. If Glu Mobile, Inc. is now both a 'Licensee' AND a 'Recipient' it is ambiguous which obligations pertain to each designation.
